definition: A grand mess; a confused situation or affair
To fiddle and mess with; to obtain something by devious or dishonest means
Of dubious integrity; low quality, unreliable or dishonest
Something remarkable; impressively large; exciting
To beg or implore something of a person; to ask to do something in haste
Making or characterized by a noisy outcry; vocally and forcefully opinionated; vehement outcry
The opposite of anxiety; tranquility of mind; absence of mental disturbance
incoherent or foolish talk; jabbering
An elongated rectangle or oval shape; having a length and width that are different; not quite sqare or circular
Consider or regard; establish; suppose; count; to attribute as having a certain qulality or value; to conclude
Lasting a brief moment
A series of winding curves; to wander at random; a tortuous or winding journey
To say something foolish or nonsensical; long-winded talk with no substance
Illegible handwriting; careless handwriting; crude or illegible scrawl
Argue loudly and concern oneself with the inconsequential; to make clamorous noises; to quarrel
A job consisting of pointless or trivial tasks; one who does useless work; Henry Chinaski's jobs in Factotum
Discomfort from eating too much
Apparently attractive but having no real value or integrity; falsely attractive; superficially significant and pretentious
Leave, move or get away quickly
Nervous or anxious fear regarding upcoming events; anxiety over uncertain future or possible ill-occurence
An intensifier: "Indeed", "really", "truthfully"; in truth; to tell the truth; in point of fact
Waste time; dilly-dally; to walk slowly and without interest or enthusiasm
To obtain through deceitful or manipulative methods; to falsify; finagle, but through extrapersonal negotiations and persuasion
"To pieces"; into separate parts
Insulting in manner or words, particularly in an arrogant or insubordinate manner; arrogant lack of respect; Starscream in Transformers
To move clumsily; to hurtle; to move heavily
Cool; impressive; interesting; stylish; excellent; clever; adept; nifty
Harsh, conflicting sounds; a state of disagreement or conflict
Not in harmony or accord; harsh or conflicting
"In truth"; truly; doubtlessly; honestly
